com.topekalabs.math.utils

Class IntUtils

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.topekalabs.math.utils.IntUtils

  • public final class IntUtils
extends Object
    This is a class which provides common utility methods for dealing with integers.
    Author:
    Topeka Labs

      • isEqualToException

        public static void isEqualToException(int value,
                      int equal,
                      String valueName)
        This method throws an IllegalArgumentException if the two given values don't equal. The name of value is added to the exception message.
        Parameters:
        value - This is compared to equal for equality.
        equal - This is compared to value for equality.
        valueName - This is the name of value.

      • safeAddException

        public static void safeAddException(int a,
                    int b)
        This method throws an IllegalArgumentException if the two provided integers cannot be added without an overflow or underflow occurring.
        Parameters:
        a - An integer to add.
        b - An integer to add.

      • isSafeAdd

        public static boolean isSafeAdd(int a,
                int b)
        This method returns true if the two provided integers can be added with an overflow or underflow.
        Parameters:
        a - An integer to be added.
        b - An integer to be added.
        Returns:
        The sum of the two provided integers.

      • safeAdd

        public static int safeAdd(int a,
          int b)
        This method safely adds two integers. An IllegalArgumentException is thrown if an underflow or overflow would occur.
        Parameters:
        a - An integer to add.
        b - An integer to add.
        Returns:
        The sum of the two input integers.
